metadata.notes: VP-level, reports to CFO. Strong fit on leadership, governance, cross-functional translation, technical depth. Gaps: no Tableau/Looker/Power BI, no SaaS or cybersecurity domain experience. High comp range ($272-368k).

summary: Executive analytics leader with 10+ years of experience defining data strategy, building analytics organizations, and driving data-driven decision-making across complex enterprises. Proven ability to serve as the bridge between technical teams and senior business stakeholders, translating business priorities into analytical frameworks and delivering actionable insights that influence strategic outcomes. Deep hands-on technical expertise in Python, SQL, predictive modeling, and data infrastructure combined with a track record of establishing data governance, leading cross-functional teams, and scaling analytics capabilities from the ground up.

bullets: Define and execute analytics strategy for a life science platform, partnering with product and commercial teams to translate business objectives into data solutions and actionable client-facing insights
Built risk-scoring models from scratch, designing the end-to-end pipeline from raw data ingestion and quality remediation through model development, validation, and operationalization
Designed a reference data architecture to harmonize data from multiple clients and external sources into a unified internal framework, establishing governance standards for consistency and accuracy
Developed a Python visualization library to standardize analytics output across the organization, reducing manual effort and ensuring reproducibility across deliverables

experience.title: Consulting Data Scientist
bullets: Delivered end-to-end predictive modeling engagements across multiple industries, managing full project lifecycle from scoping and stakeholder alignment through deployment and iteration
Built a production classification model for a SaaS platform that runs nightly, demonstrating ability to operate in fast-moving product environments
Partnered directly with VP-level client stakeholders and engineering teams, translating complex analytical outputs into actionable business recommendations

experience.title: Director, Data & Analytics (Medical Affairs)
bullets: Defined and executed enterprise data and analytics strategy, serving as strategic advisor to senior leadership and aligning analytics roadmap with organizational business objectives

Managed the analytics team through hiring, onboarding, and performance development, building a high-performing group focused on dashboard and reporting delivery

bullets: Led the digital and data science group and the statistical monitoring group, providing cross-functional analytics leadership across manufacturing, quality, and operations stakeholders

cover_letter.opening: I am writing to express my strong interest in the Vice President of Data Analytics role at 1Password. The opportunity to define analytics strategy, elevate data maturity, and serve as the bridge between technical teams and senior business leaders at a company of 1Password's scale and growth trajectory is exactly the kind of challenge I have been building toward across my career.
body: My background is built on doing exactly what this role requires: translating business priorities into analytical frameworks, building analytics organizations from the ground up, and ensuring data becomes a trusted, actionable asset across an enterprise. At Gilead Sciences, I served as Director of Data & Analytics, where I defined enterprise analytics strategy, built the organization's centralized data lake, established data governance and metric-definition frameworks, and led the internal analytics team through hiring and development - all while functioning as a strategic advisor to senior leadership. At Takeda, I led both the digital and data science function and the statistical monitoring group, partnering across manufacturing, quality, and operations to translate complex analytics into business decisions that leadership could act on. In both roles, I owned the full scope from technical infrastructure to executive communication.

I am a hands-on leader who stays close to the technical work while operating at a strategic level. At Redica Systems, I personally built the risk-scoring models and data architecture that power the platform's client-facing analytics, while simultaneously defining the analytics strategy and partnering with product teams on priorities. Through my consulting practice, I have delivered production-grade modeling engagements for SaaS platforms, working directly with VP-level stakeholders and engineering teams. This combination of deep technical fluency and cross-functional leadership is what enables me to serve as an effective bridge - and it is the core of what I would bring to 1Password.

1Password's mission to make digital life safer and more productive, combined with the company's rapid growth and the breadth of this role's scope, represents a compelling opportunity. I would welcome the chance to discuss how my experience in analytics strategy, data governance, and cross-functional leadership can contribute to advancing data maturity and decision-making across your organization.
cover_letter.closing: Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to the possibility of continuing this conversation.
